{"step_by_step_thinking": "Intradermal nevus is a benign skin lesion and rarely turns malignant. Lichen planus is an inflammatory condition and not typically associated with malignancy. Papilloma is a benign epithelial tumor and also has a low risk of malignancy. Junctional nevus, however, is a type of mole that is found at the junction of the epidermis and dermis. It has a higher risk of turning into melanoma, a type of skin cancer, compared to the other options.", "answer_choice": "B"}
